Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Sh-lantibiotic-alpha (natural AMPs; lantibiotic;  bacteriocin; Gram-positive bacteria, commensal bacteria, prokaryotes; UCSS1b)
Sequence Information.Source: Staphylococcus hominisA9, Human Microbiota:skin, symbiont bacteria

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of THE PEPTIDE shows 66.7% similarity tobacterial Plantaricin W.Activity: Active against S. aureus, but not commensal bacteria.Chemical modification:  Three thioether bonds are proposed: S8-C18, T19-C24, S21-C28 and one S-S bond between C2-C9.Updated 4/2024
Literature Information.Author: Nakatsuji T, Chen TH, Narala S, Chun KA, Two AM, Yun T, Shafiq F, Kotol PF, Bouslimani A, Melnik AV, Latif H, Kim JN, Lockhart A, Artis K, David G, Taylor P, Streib J, Dorrestein PC, Grier A, Gill SR, Zengler K, Hata TR, Leung DY, Gallo RL.2017
Literature Information.Title: Antimicrobials from human skin commensal bacteria protect against Staphylococcus aureus and are deficient in atopic dermatitis
